Sumner Attendance Center Facebook page will be deactivated on Thursday, June 12, 2020. All communication will be posted on the new District Website and District Facebook page. Please follow the new District Facebook page at https://www.facebook.com/Red-Hill-Community-School-District-10-102455151411912/ Facebook page

The new District website page can be found at https://www.cusd10.org/ Plus you can download the Red Hill CUSD 10 app from the Google Play Store or Apple Store.

post_text:
SAC Teachers and Staff want to say goodbye to our students for the Summer

On Wednesday, May 20th your SAC teachers and staff will line Locust street in front of Sumner Attendance Center from 5:00-5:45 to say goodbye for the summer to our kids. We would like to have as many of our students as possible drive-by at this time so we can wish them a wonderful summer.

We will be following social distancing and other recommendations from our local health department. Please stay in your car.

We hope to see as many of our students as possible.

post_text:
NOTICE OF PUBLIC MEETING

On Friday, May 1, 2020 at 9:00 a.m., a meeting conducted by Red Hill CUSD #10 will take place at the Red Hill CUSD #10 Unit Office, 1250 Judy Avenue, Bridgeport. The purpose of the meeting will be to discuss the district’s plans for providing special education services to students with disabilities who attend private schools and home schools within the District for the 2020-2021 school year. If you are a parent of a home-schooled student who has been or may be identified with a disability, and you reside within the boundaries of Red Hill CUSD #10, you are urged to attend. If you have further questions pertaining to the meeting, please contact Mr. Clarence W. Gross, Jr. at 945-2521.
text:
NOTICE OF PUBLIC MEETING

If you are a parent of a home-schooled student who has been or may be identified with a disability, and you reside within the boundaries of Red Hill CUSD #10, you are urged to attend. If you have further questions pertaining to the meeting, please contact Mr. Clarence W. Gross, Jr. at 945-2521.

post_text: While on-site learning remains suspended, Red Hill's commitment to learning and education will remain open and continue for all students in Red Hill CUSD #10. The district has used the following days: March 31st through April 6th for teacher remote learning professional development. The district will honor April 9th and April 10th for Spring Break. Red Hill CUSD #10 Remote Learning Plan has been placed on the district website at cusd10.org. If you have any questions, please call the District Office at 618-945-2061.

post_text:
Today, we went to the San Diego Zoo (virtually of course). We watched all of the live animal cams but our favorite was the Apes. They were swinging and playing together.
Fun fact: Did you know a polar bear’s nose is so powerful it can smell a seal up to 20 miles away?

post_text: Red Hill is very appreciative of our Fish and Loaves program. This program continues to provide a breakfast and dinner item for our free lunch pick-up. The program continues to provide extra meals for the weekend. The extra meals are distributed with the Friday free lunch pick-up. Thank you again for making a huge difference in our students' lives!

post_text: Red Hill CUSD #10 will continue to serve a free lunch for students 18 and younger through the April 7th closure. Bridgeport Grade School and Sumner Attendance Center will continue to distribute “Grab and Go” lunches along with food from the Lawrence County Fish and Loaves. NEW: If you live out of town and have no means of getting to one of the two distribution points, you may call (618) 945-2061 and press 1 to request delivery. For families requesting delivery, we will make every effort to make deliveries from 11:00 a.m. – 12:00 p.m. The current goal, depending on demand is to start deliveries on Monday, March 30, 2020.

post_text: Today at SAC, the staff wore our Team Mitchell t-shirts to honor Mrs. Mitchell. As you can see several of us gathered for a picture towards the end of the day. We even managed to get some pictures of those who had to leave earlier in the day. A BIG thank you to all who participated today. Next week, we will be placing an order for more t-shirts for those who have turned in order forms. You can still send in your forms on Monday and Tuesday. The order will be placed on Wednesday afternoon. All proceeds from these shirts go to Mrs. Mitchell's medical expenses. SAC students and staff love Mrs. Mitchell. We are thinking of her daily as she is away from us. Get well soon, Mrs. Mitchell. We miss you.
text: Today at SAC, the staff wore our Team Mitchell t-shirts to honor Mrs. Mitchell. As you can see several of us gathered for a picture towards the end of the day. We even managed to get some pictures of those who had to leave earlier in the day. A BIG thank you to all who participated today. Next week, we will be placing an order for more t-shirts for those who have turned in order forms. You can still send in your forms on Monday and Tuesday. The order will be placed on Wednesday afternoon. All proceeds from these shirts go to Mrs. Mitchell's medical expenses. SAC students and staff love Mrs. Mitchell. We are thinking of her daily as she is away from us. Get well soon, Mrs. Mitchell. We miss you.

post_text:
We encourage everyone to be at Sumner Attendance Center Saturday night for the Regina Mitchell Benefit. Activities are as follows:

Chicken and Noodle Dinner - 4:30 - 6:30 in the cafeteria for a free-will donation.

Auction - 6:45 - ?????? In the gym. Many donated items will be auctioned off by Rothrock Auction.

Toy walk- 7:00 pm. Many activities for the kids in the music room. The toy walk will be similar to a cakewalk with toys being the prize. The cost will be fifty cents per walk. A movie will be shown after the toy walk.

We hope to see all of you out to support Mrs. Mitchell and her family.

shared_text:
Emily Combs Photography added 9 new photos to the album: We love Mrs. Mitchell — with Regina Spillman Mitchell at Sumner Attendance Center.
November 26, 2019 at 1:37 PM · Sumner, IL ·

The 4-6th graders and all the staff at Sumner Attendance Center wanted to honor a very special lady today. Mrs. Mitchell is our 4th grade math teacher at SAC who recently found out that she is very sick.

Today the district wore pajamas and hats to help raise money to help with medical expenses and everyone at SAC wanted to do something a little extra so they made this amazing banner and had all the kiddoes and staff sign it.

We are so blessed with a community that is there to help and support one of our own. <3

Feel free to tag yourselves, Facebook isn't allowing me to tag anyone else after I posted!
text:
Emily Combs Photography added 9 new photos to the album: We love Mrs. Mitchell — with Regina Spillman Mitchell at Sumner Attendance Center.

Today the district wore pajamas and hats to help raise money to help with medical expenses and everyone at SAC wanted to do something a little extra so they made this amazing banner and had all the kiddoes and staff sign it.

We are so blessed with a community that is there to help and support one of our own. <3

Feel free to tag yourselves, Facebook isn't allowing me to tag anyone else after I posted!

post_text:
ATTENTION, ATTENTION, ATTENTION

SAC loves Mrs. Mitchell ~ as we know she is sick right now. She has been a teacher for the
Unit for many, many years. We want to show her our support by having a special day
and by raising some money to help her with some medical expenses she will be having. SOOOOOO ~

Tuesday, November 26th will be Hat & Pajama Day at SAC

- Costs $1 to wear PJs for the day & $1 to wear a hat for the day -

If you choose to wear both, it will cost $2

All funds collected will go directly to help with Mrs Mitchell's expenses.

These funds will be delivered to her on Tuesday night after school.

post_text: Sumner Attendance Center had 6 6th grade choir students that were accepted to participate in our ILMEA District 5 Elementary Festival. These students were: Maggi Buchanan, Amelia Crask, Emma Miller, Sierra Shepard, Susie Silverthorne, and Kenna Thacker. They learned 5 choir pieces and then on Monday, November 4th traveled to Eastern University to rehearse with 160 other students from around 20 other counties. They then performed a concert for their friends and family.

These students were: Maggi Buchanan, Amelia Crask, Emma Miller, Sierra Shepard, Susie Silverthorne, and Kenna Thacker. They learned 5 choir pieces and then on Monday, November 4th traveled to Eastern University to rehearse with 160 other students from around 20 other counties. They then performed a concert for their friends and family.

Attention 5th-grade Beginning Band members!
We will have Beginning Band Boot Camp on Monday and Tuesday, August 12th and 13th. This will take place in the SAC music room. If you have ordered an instrument, you will receive it then. 😀. If you have an instrument already, please bring it with you! If you haven’t signed up for Band yet and your student wants to, please contact Mrs. Hasewinkle at 618 839 0804. Thanks!

9:00-9:30. Flutes
8:30-10:00. Clarinets
10:00-10:30. Percussion
10:30-11:00. Saxophones
11:00-11:30. Trumpets
11:30-12:00. Trombones

Can’t wait to get a jump start on a fantastic year!

shared_text:
Red Hill JR/SR High School
July 30, 2019 at 3:40 PM ·

RED HILL C.U.S.D #10
2019 - 2020 STUDENT REGISTRATION

ONLINE REGISTRATION
Beginning this year, we will be doing online registration through our new Skyward Student Management System. Registration materials will be available online beginning on Wednesday, July 31, 2019. The link to access the Skyward Online Registration Site is https://skyward.iscorp.com/RedHill10ILStuSTS. Once on this website, you will need to click on the Registration 2019 - 2020 Tile for each of your students. To complete the online registration, you will need your parental login and password information. You can obtain this information beginning on July 31, 2019 by contacting one of the district school offices during business hours. Individuals completing their registration materials online will still need to pay their fees in one of the school offices or at the registration day on August 5, 2019.

THESE PHOTOS ARE PARENT HELP DOCUMENTS TO HELP NAVIGATE THE SKYWARD SYSTEM FOR REGISTERING.

post_text:
The Lawrence County Health Department will be at Sumner Attendance Center on May 17th to provide required immunizations for incoming 6th-grade students. (current 5th-grade students) If you want your child to receive these vaccines at school, the patient registration for school located vaccine clinic form and the screening checklist for contraindications for school located vaccine clinic form sent home with your child must be completed, signed, and returned to SAC no later than May 13th.

It is your responsibility to check and make sure the immunizations are covered by your child's health insurance. A copy of your insurance will also be necessary.

If you have any questions please call SAC at 936-2412

post_text:
Sumner Attendance Center Band students did a great job this past Saturday at our District's Solo and Ensemble Contest. ALL students received a first division rating on their solos and duets and Maggi Buchanan received a First Superior rating for her vocal solo.
SAC students that participated were:
Lilyana Adams (snare drum), Bayli Brown (snare drum), Maggi Buchanan (piano and vocal), Amelia Crask (snare drum), Joseph Gonzalez (trumpet), Paige Hill (clarinet), Jeremy Jones (snare), Laney Miller (clarinet), Kenna Thacker (flute), Leah Weber (alto saxophone), Jeremiah Young (clarinet), Paige Hill and Laney Miller (clarinet duet) and Lily Combs and Addison Dining (flute/bells duet)
not pictured, Lilyana Adams

1st place- Mrs. Rhinehart

A big thank you to our judges this year Officer Trainer and Officer Hofmann.

post_text: The American Legion Auxiliary Lawrence Unit #28 donated 660 items or 66- 10 of anything to Sumner Attendance Center. Lawrence Unit #28 has donated to the local schools for the past 12 years through their educational program "10 of Anything". Pictured are members of the American Legion Auxiliary Lawrence Unit #28 and students from SAC who have parents or siblings that served our country.
